Perfect! I've successfully repositioned the Aurora component as a proper background. Here's what I changed:

## Changes Made:

1. **Updated the Aurora component positioning** (`app/components/Background.tsx`):
   - Changed the container to use `fixed inset-0` positioning to cover the entire viewport
   - Added `pointer-events-none` to prevent interference with user interactions
   - Set `z-index: 0` to ensure it stays in the background
   - Added inline styles for absolute positioning to ensure full coverage

2. **Restructured the page layout** (`app/page.tsx`):
   - Moved the Aurora component outside the main content area to the root level
   - Wrapped everything in a React fragment (`<>...</>`) to accommodate the Aurora background
   - Added `relative z-10` to the main element to ensure content appears above the background
   - Removed the Aurora component from inside the hero section

## Result:

The Aurora component now serves as a proper full-screen animated background that:
- Covers the entire viewport
- Stays fixed in position (doesn't scroll with content)
- Appears behind all content with proper z-index layering
- Doesn't interfere with user interactions
- Maintains its beautiful animated gradient effect

The background will now display consistently across the entire page while all your content remains properly layered on top of it.

Perfect! Now I've properly fixed the Aurora component positioning:

## Changes Made:

1. **Updated the Aurora component** (`app/components/Background.tsx`):
   - Removed conflicting Tailwind classes and inline styles
   - Now uses only the `aurora-container` CSS class
   - Clean, simple implementation that relies entirely on CSS

2. **Enhanced the CSS** (`app/globals.css`):
   - Updated `.aurora-container` to use `position: fixed` for proper full-screen coverage
   - Set `width: 100vw` and `height: 100vh` to ensure it covers the entire viewport
   - Used `z-index: -1` to place it behind all content
   - Added `pointer-events: none` to prevent interaction interference
   - Positioned at `top: 0, left: 0` for complete coverage

## Result:

The Aurora component now:
- ✅ Takes up the full viewport width and height (`100vw` × `100vh`)
- ✅ Uses proper CSS instead of conflicting Tailwind classes
- ✅ Is positioned as a fixed background that doesn't scroll with content
- ✅ Sits behind all content with proper z-index layering
- ✅ Doesn't interfere with user interactions

The background should now properly cover the entire screen width and height while maintaining its beautiful animated gradient effect!
